title: Hughtun Hector
text:
Hughtun Hector (born 16 October 1984) is a <a href="association%20football">football</a> player from <a href="Trinidad%20and%20Tobago">Trinidad and Tobago</a>. He currently plays for <a href="W%20Connection">W Connection</a>.
Club career.
Hector began his career in the youth ranks of <a href="W%20Connection">W Connection</a> before making his professional debut with the senior squad in 2008. Since then he has been one of the top midfielders in Trinidad and Tobago. While with Connection he has helped the club in capturing two domestic cups and the <a href="2009%20CFU%20Club%20Championship">2009 CFU Club Championship</a>. During Connection's title run in the 2009 CFU Club Championship Hector recorded a hat-trick in a 5–0 rout over Centre Bath Estate. He ended as the competitions second leading scorer with 5 goals. On July 30, 2009, he scored the equalizing goal for Connection in a 2–2 draw with <a href="New%20York%20Red%20Bulls">New York Red Bulls</a> in a <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20CONCACAF%20Champions%20League">2009–10 CONCACAF Champions League</a> match.
His play with Connection and Trinidad and Tobago helped Hector to draw the attention of several foreign clubs. During October 2010 he went on trial with Ukraine top flight club <a href="PFC%20Sevastopol">PFC Sevastopol</a>. During March 2011 it was reported that Hector would go on trial with <a href="New%20York%20Red%20Bulls">New York Red Bulls</a> in hopes of a securing a contract with the <a href="Major%20League%20Soccer">Major League Soccer</a> club. After spending two years at <a href="S%C3%B4ng%20Lam%20Ngh%E1%BB%87%20An%20F.C.">Sông Lam Nghệ An</a> he signed for <a href="H%C3%A0%20N%E1%BB%99i%20T%26amp%3BT%20F.C.">Hanoi T&T</a> for the 2014 season.
International career.
Hector is a member of the Trinidad and Tobago <a href="Trinidad%20and%20Tobago%20national%20football%20team">national team</a>.
